WITHHOLDING AN ESTATE
(1) If an heir or a legatee submits a claim, the court shall withhold the property or a part of the estate needed to cover the claim until the competent authority of the foreign state issues a final decree on such a claim.
(2) With regard to the claim, the court shall execute the aforementioned decree from the withheld estate or part thereof, and it shall hand over the rest to the competent authority of the foreign state.
(3) If a creditor submits a claim, the court shall withhold the estate or a part of it needed to cover the claim until the claim has been paid or secured.
